questions.question_text: What is the minimum level of SNMP that provides encryption?

choices.D: It runs normally and flags all possible ACE entries as invalid. A
choices.B: It runs normally and reports that traffic for all possible protocol matches is denied.
choices.C: It fails to execute the path trace.
choices.A: It runs normally and reports all possible ACE matches for the protocol field.

questions.question_text: You attempt to execute the APIC-EM ACL path trace feature without specifying the protocol. How does the ACL path trace respond?

discussion.content: A & E are the correct answers

questions.question_text: Which two statements identify differences between single-homed and dual-homed WAN topologies? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Single-homed topologies are more costly to an enterprise than dual-homed topologies
choices.E: Single-homed topologies are more appropriate for small-business networks than dual-homed topologies AE
choices.B: Only dual-homed connections require dynamic routing to the ISP
choices.D: Only dual-homed connections are connected to the same ISP
choices.A: Dual-homed topologies provide greater redundancy than single-homed topologies

questions.question_text: Which type of routing protocol relies on the shortest path tree?
Which two features are supported only in named access lists? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
It's D & E.

It's not B because both named and numbered access lists can be applied to VTY lines.
